# Aeva Technologies (AEVA) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

Aeva Technologies, Inc. engages in the design, development, manufacture, and sale of LiDAR sensing systems, and related perception and autonomy-enabling software solutions in North America, Europe, the Middle East, Africa, and Asia. The company develops its products using frequency modulated continuous wave (FMCW) sensing technology. Aeva Technologies, Inc. was founded in 2017 and is headquartered in Mountain View, California.

Aeva is transforming autonomy with its groundbreaking sensing and perception technology that integrates all key LiDAR components onto a silicon photonics chip in a compact module. Aeva 4D LiDAR sensors uniquely detect instant velocity in addition to 3D position, allowing autonomous devices to make more intelligent decisions. Aeva's mission is to bring the next wave of perception to a broad range of applications from automated driving, manufacturing automation and smart infrastructure, to robotics and consumer devices.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

It offers Aeries II, a 4D LiDAR solution that consist of 4D LiDAR sensing system with embedded software for automotive grade production across passenger car, trucking, and mobility applications; Atlas, a FMCW 4D LiDAR with simultaneous velocity and range detection for mass production and built to meet automotive-grade requirements; and Atlas Ultra, a 4D LiDAR sensor built to meet the performance demands of SAE Level 3 and 4 automated driving systems in passenger and commercial vehicles.

The company's products are also used in consumer devices, industrial automation, and security market applications. Aeva unveiled its Eve 1 line of high-precision laser displacement sensors, designed for high-volume and inline industrial automation applications.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

**Aeva Omni™ (CES 2026):** Today, at CES 2026, Aeva announced Aeva Omni™, the industry's first wide-view short-range 4D LiDAR sensor for physical AI applications. Developed in partnership with LG Innotek, a leading provider of cutting-edge mobility sensing solutions and an affiliate of the LG Group, Omni provides an unprecedented level of environmental awareness for both dynamic and confined operating environments including autonomous vehicles, drones and defense applications, robotics, warehouse automation, and smart infrastructure.

Aeva Omni will be available in second half of 2026 for early customer pilots, with production targeted in 2027.

## 5. Growth Strategy

This collaboration establishes the foundation to accelerate the adoption of Aeva's FMCW-based perception platform into Physical AI—where intelligent systems equipped with sensors, processing, and AI software can perceive, understand and interact with the physical world in real time.

**Multi-Market Approach:** The company is expanding beyond automotive into industrial automation, robotics, and consumer devices. Aeva has increased its full-year revenue guidance to 80% to 100% growth compared to fiscal year 2024. This upward revision reflects increased momentum in both industrial and automotive markets.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

**Automotive OEMs:** Successfully completed the joint development program with a Top-10 global passenger OEM and advanced to late-stage contract negotiations for a large scale series production award. Aeva in December announced an exclusive agreement with an unnamed European automaker that analysts have linked to Mercedes-Benz.

**Commercial Partners:**

- The event featured presentations from major partners including Mercedes-Benz, Daimler Truck, and Torc Robotics
- The company has already begun shipping to customers including Sotereon.ai and D2 Traffic Technologies

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

**Q3 2025 Results:** Non-GAAP operating loss of $27.2 million in Q3 2025, compared to non-GAAP operating loss of $31.4 million in Q3 2024. Key financial highlights include record quarterly revenue of $5.5M in Q2 2025, up from $2.0M in Q2 2024, though reporting a GAAP operating loss of $34.9M.

**Strategic Investment:** Aeva announced that funds managed by Apollo (the "Apollo Funds") will invest $100M in 4.375% Convertible Senior Notes to support Aeva's growing commercial momentum. This capital infusion brings the company's pro forma liquidity to approximately $270 million.

## 8. Market Shares

**LiDAR Market Context:** The U.S. LiDAR Market was valued at USD 679.4 million in 2024, and is projected to reach USD 2.35 billion by 2030, rising at a CAGR of 23.90%.

**Competitive Position:** Hesai (HSAI): Dominates the automotive lidar market with 33.5% share, but faces execution risks. Aeva is positioned as an emerging player with differentiated FMCW technology versus traditional time-of-flight approaches used by competitors.

## 9. Comparison to Competitors

**Key Competitors:** MicroVision, Innoviz Technologies, Velodyne Lidar, Ouster, and Luminar Technologies are some of the 12 competitors of Aeva Technologies.

**Competitive Advantages:** By combining lidar, radar, and camera technologies into a single sensor, Aeva offers a comprehensive solution for autonomous machines that is unmatched by its competitors. Aeva's unique approach to lidar technology positions it as a key player in the market.

**Market Positioning:** Aeva (AEVA) is the best bet if you believe in the long-term potential of 4D lidar and autonomous vehicles. Aeva Technologies (AEVA) stands out for its cutting-edge 4D FMCW lidar-on-a-chip technology and recent partnerships.

## 10. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

**LG Innotek Strategic Partnership:** The partnership includes a strategic investment by LG Innotek of up to approximately $50 million comprising the anticipated equity stake in Aeva, non-dilutive investment for new product development, and capital investments to bring production capacity online for Aeva's next generation products. To establish a strategic and long-term partnership with Aeva, the Korean electronics parts maker will acquire about 6 percent of Aeva's shares.

**NVIDIA Partnership:** At CES 2026, Aeva announced that its Frequency Modulated Continuous Wave (FMCW) 4D LiDAR technology has been selected for the NVIDIA DRIVE Hyperion autonomous vehicle reference platform. The integration marks a significant milestone for Aeva as its role expands as a core LiDAR sensor supplier to global passenger and commercial vehicle OEMs.
